author: Stephen S. Hall is a contributing writer for the magazine. His most recent article was about embryo research.

title: The Smart Set

body: Vintage after vintage, Dry Creek Vineyards' racy dry sauvignon blanc reflects the steady-as-you-go grace of the sailboat on its label. Since the 70's, the owner, David Stare, a passionate boatsmen, has farmed the Dry Creek Valley. He helped introduce the Loire's sauvignon grape there, and his version of its wine has become a model in California.
title: WINE UNDER $20; A Sailor's Sauvignon Blanc
